drug_mismatch.description: Corticosteroid indication text assigned to non-CS drugs (lidocaine, bupivacaine)
details: Lidocaine: 78 rows have CS indication text (psoriasis, ITP, asthma, SLE, etc.)
Bupivacaine: 61 rows have CS indication text (similar diseases)
Also affects expanded GT: 104 lidocaine + 63 bupivacaine = 167 false GT entries from EC

false_indication.description: Disease mentioned in differential diagnosis/exclusion context, not treatment
details: Hydroxocobalamin → folate deficiency: B12 doesnt treat folate deficiency
Hydroxocobalamin → iron deficiency: B12 doesnt treat iron deficiency

risk_reduction.description: Drug reduces risk of disease but isnt indicated FOR the disease
details: HCTZ/telmisartan → stroke: indicated for hypertension, reduces stroke risk

questionable.description: Diagnostic agents or drug components listed as treatments
details: Isosulfan blue → chylous ascites: diagnostic dye, not treatment
Calcium → acute renal failure: component of dialysis solution

key_finding: Drug mismatch is the dominant error type. 139/10224 rows (1.4%) have corticosteroid text assigned to lidocaine/bupivacaine. This propagates to expanded GT (167 false entries) and potentially to DRKG internal GT (43 lidocaine + 28 bupivacaine false entries).
impact: False GT entries inflate holdout precision for predictions involving lidocaine/bupivacaine as neighbors. Since both drugs are in LOW tier (procedural LA demotion from h540), impact on MEDIUM+ tiers is minimal.
action_items: Add lidocaine/bupivacaine corticosteroid-indication false GT entries to FALSE_GT_PAIRS
Check if DRKG internal GT also has these errors
Investigate other potential combo-product drug mismatch patterns
